title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: I have a board that powers on but the screen remains blank. Backlight is working but there is no video. What is good place to start troubleshooting this issue?

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message:
[COLOR=#2C2C2C][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]Louis wrote this in 2013 :)

"Image, no backlight = motherboard[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#2C2C2C][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]no image, no backlight = screen[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]
[COLOR=#2C2C2C][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]no image, backlight = cable[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#2C2C2C][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]This isn't exact, but most of the time.[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

[COLOR=#2C2C2C][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]Unplug the video cable, and plug it back in. Keep the battery unplugged, of course."

I would check the cable first, for that you have to remove the screen. Or try plugin it to another motherboard if you can.

Hope that helps[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message:
Holy crap,where did you find that? I remember typing that.. I have no idea where. :)

How did this come to you? Drop, liquid damage, out of the blue? 

First thing is to try known good screen/cable. because this is a board repair forum, I am going to make the assumption that you have already done that, and not suggest it(but if you haven't, I'm going to kick your ass). :D

Second thing to check is 3.3v on pin 2/3 of LCD connector. Not 1v, not 1.5v, not 2.7v, but a full 3.3v.

Third thing to check is that the little clock filter on the LVDS line is good. My favorite way to check if it is good is to just replace it since it takes less time to do that than to drive myself nuts.. but this machine is too "new" for that to go bad.

This board was originally liquid damaged. I did try a different display and the same issue persists.

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: Q9707 wouldn't allow backlight through without vcore. I am guessing it chimes.

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: Yes it does chime.

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: You said this is water damage, the water damage was around LVDS connector? Did you replace the connector? maybe is just a fucked up connector.. DIode mode measurements on LVDS connector?

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: There wasn't any corrosion around the LVDS connector. I can replace it anyway just be sure. It's just odd that I'm getting a black screen with the backlight working as opposed to the white screen that I should be getting. Plugged it into another display and it does the same thing. Display is confirmed to be good.

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: PPVCORE_S0_AXG is what voltage? Also, displayport to vga, do you see anything?

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: Check all LVDS lines at the LCD connector on diode mode pin 8-18. Damaged L9080 is also common.

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: When I disconnect the screen and connect an external display via thunderbolt, I get video.

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message:
Excuse the noob question, but where would I measure PPVCORE_S0_AXG?
I searched for the net in BV, but can't seem to locate that components. 

Where would I measure it in this case?

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 818"]DIode mode measurements on LVDS connector?[/QUOTE]

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 933"]Check all LVDS lines at the LCD connector on diode mode pin 8-18. Damaged L9080 is also common.[/QUOTE]

Two request of measures and no answer at all............hmmm

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: L7550 (PPVCORE_S0_AXG_R), this voltage will not be present if the screen is not present or it is not recognized....

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working

 The traces between PIN 17,18 and the L9080 are good as well

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: Check coil L9080, you should have continuity between pin 1-2 and between 3-4, as you say "P[COLOR=#454545][FONT=Helvetica]IN 17 - OL" my guess is there is no continuity on pin 3-4 from L9080, so, coil is bad and for pin 15 you say  "[/FONT][/COLOR][FONT=Helvetica][COLOR=#454545]PIN 15 - 0.187" this value is too low so may guess is a bad PCH.....[/COLOR][/FONT]

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message: This is a dead PCH. Replace PCH and see if LCD works again. After that you will need to write a BIOS with clean ME!

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working

title: [solved]820-3115 no video, backlight is working
message:
IMO BGA rework in 2016 is a waste. 

In 2006/2007/2008 before Apple recalled the A1226/A1260, at the heydey of the NVIDIA issues, you could print money on BGA rework.

Now it is just a bunch of money to invest in something you use every now and then. What if the PCH you bought was dead? What if it was something but the PCH? You invest an hour of your time and $30-$50 into a repair that may not even work, that's after investing thousands into a BGA machine and countless hours fucking with it to figure it out.
